content.raw:
I'll read the first version soon. I have to spend the afternoon at SRI though.

It might be worthwhile to layout a set of typical scenarios, like you did with the polaris. Such as: 

1. A user is creating a world and simulation is paused while they use undo.
2. A user is creating a world with dynamic objects, and they switch between play and pause to get everything setup correctly.
3. A user has a running simulation that they wan to manipulate in some way.

It might be the case that option 1 doesn't provide the necessary flexibility. If this is the case, then option 2 and keyframing would be a better option.
